title: Banchero, Magic agree to $239M rookie max deal
content: Magic star Paolo Banchero has agreed to a five-year, $239 million maximum rookie contract extension that could reach $287 million, his agent told ESPN.

title: Elder Chavez defends son arrested by ICE agents
content: Former world champ Julio Cesar Chavez is set to defend his same-name son, who was arrested by U.S. immigration agents at his Los Angeles home for overstaying his visa and lying on a green card application.

title: Pacers confirm Haliburton won't play next season
content: The Indiana Pacers confirmed what was expected: that star point guard Tyrese Haliburton will miss the entire 2025-26 season after surgery to repair a torn right Achilles tendon.

title: Brown brings 'championship pedigree' to Knicks
content: The Knicks officially hired Mike Brown as their head coach, turning to the two-time NBA Coach of the Year after firing Tom Thibodeau.

title: Twins' Buxton to take part in Home Run Derby
content: Twins outfielder and Georgia native Byron Buxton was announced as the fourth participant in the Home Run Derby.

title: Sinner advances despite elbow as Dimitrov retires
content: Jannik Sinner advanced to the Wimbledon quarterfinals despite hurting his right elbow in a fall in the opening game and dropping the first two sets Monday night, after his opponent, Grigor Dimitrov, wound up retiring because of an injured pectoral muscle.

title: Reese latest to blast WNBA refs: 'Has to be fixed'
content: Sky forward Angel Reese became the WNBA's latest high-profile figure to call out the league's officials, saying "it has to be fixed" and "I am tired of this s---."

title: Powell to Heat, Collins to Clips in 3-team trade
content: The Clippers, Jazz and Heat have agreed to a trade that sends Norman Powell to Miami, John Collins to Los Angeles, and Kevin Love, Kyle Anderson and a 2027 Clippers second-round pick to Utah.

title: 📋 MLB draft guide: Latest intel for all 30 teams
content: Who will the Nationals take No. 1? Who is atop your team's board? Kiley McDaniel lays it all out as draft week arrives.

title: NBA free agency superlatives: Best, worst, underrated moves
content: Which deals will impact the title race? Which will leave teams in regret by Christmas? Our NBA insiders make their picks.

title: MLB GMs tell their best (and wildest) trade stories: 'I had to go in the basement of the bar where all the liquor is being stored'
content: From texts during life events to the best deadline deals that never happened, MLB front office execs tell all.

title: Who are the NFL's best running backs? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Execs, coaches, scouts and players from around the league ranked their top 10 in our annual summer series.

title: From WrestleMania moves to showing off his jump shot: How Pete Carroll is rebuilding Raiders culture
content: Carroll's competitive nature and fun-loving spirit is palpable, and the Raiders are hoping their new approach will translate to wins.

title: What Nationals' overhaul means for their No. 1 draft pick, trade deadline plans
content: Washington fired its GM and manager as draft and trade season heat up. Here's how the fallout could play out.

title: All-Star rosters: Biggest snubs and other takeaways
content: Some of the game's biggest names are headed to Atlanta, but some deserving stars will be watching from home.

title: The most obscure MLB All-Stars ever
content: Hunter Goodman just became an All-Star -- not the first time an unfamiliar player is headed to Midsummer Classic.

title: USMNT's real test will be learning from Gold Cup final loss to Mexico
content: There were plenty of difficult lessons for the USMNT in the Gold Cup final loss to Mexico on Sunday. How Mauricio Pochettino & Co. respond will be telling.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Belgium have no answer to Spain's late onslaught
content: Spain produced a scintillating second half performance to romp to a 6-2 victory over Belgium. Here's what else you need to know from Euro 2025 action.

title: Running back rankings: Who are the most reliable TD scorers?
content: From Jahmyr Gibbs and Derrick Henry to Bijan Robinson, we rank the running backs based on the most dependable at finding the end zone.

title: Sources: Arsenal closing in on $76M Gyökeres deal
content: Arsenal are close to sealing a move for Sporting Lisbon forward Viktor Gyökeres, sources have told ESPN.

title: Poch: USMNT Gold Cup lessons 'priceless, painful'
content: United States coach Maurico Pochettino said his team had learned "priceless" lessons despite a "painful" 2-1 loss to rival Mexico during Sunday's Gold Cup final.

title: Sources: Atlético, Miami in talks over De Paul
content: Inter Miami is holding talks with Atlético Madrid to sign Rodrigo De Paul, sources confirmed with ESPN.

title: Fluminense want 'game of chess' in Chelsea semi
content: Fluminense are relishing their role as the Club World Cup's underdogs ahead of Tuesday's semi-final against Chelsea, with manager Renato Gaucho embracing an "us against the world" mentality that has carried the Brazilian side to an improbable run.

title: Putellas nets 2 as Spain trounce Belgium at Euros
content: Striker Alexia Putellas scored twice for world champions Spain as they shook off a slow start to beat Belgium 6-2 in their Women's Euros Group B clash on Monday.

title: USWNT's Yohannes completes Lyonnes deal
content: United States women's national team midfielder Lily Yohannes has signed a three-year contract with French powerhouse OL Lyonnes, the club announced on Monday.

title: Source: Liverpool to begin preseason on Tuesday
content: Liverpool players are set to report for preseason training on Tuesday, following the death of forward Diogo Jota, a source told ESPN.

title: Maresca: Madueke can play amid transfer 'noise'
content: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca has said Noni Madueke remains available to play at the Club World Cup despite the club holding talks over a potential move to London rivals Arsenal.

title: MLS Power Rankings: As Vancouver slips, Nashville is new No. 1
content: Injury-hit Vancouver fell to the Galaxy, leaving the door open for Nashville to take top spot in ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: The four biggest lessons of free agency's first wave
content: Why did so many players simply re-sign instead of exploring the market? Here are 2025's hottest hockey trends.

title: 'I never doubted him': F1 celebrates Nico Hülkenberg's long-overdue first podium
content: In a 15-year F1 career, Nico Hülkenberg had never tasted podium champagne. That changed at Silverstone, an achievement celebrated up and down pit lane.

title: Remembering Ruffian 50 years after her breakdown at Belmont
content: The filly shattered her right front ankle in a match race against Kentucky Derby winner Foolish Pleasure.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona told price to sign Rafael Leão
content: Barcelona have been told what they will need to pay to sign Rafael Leão from AC Milan. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Transfer window weekly: Gyökeres close to Arsenal? Chelsea, City to trim squad?
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Waiver wire: Brewers ace finally returns to the mound
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire, including a returning one-time Cy Young contender.

title: What to expect from Norman Powell, John Collins
content: Andre Snellings and Eric Moody break down all off the trades and signings of the offseason in the NBA, including Norman Powell and John Collins on the move.

title: Dropped from official holiday calendar by L-G, ruling NC starts preparations for ‘Martyrs Day’ in Srinagar
content: The preparations assumed significance because J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha removed the ‘Martyrs Day’ from the official holiday calendar of the government after the Centre ended J&K’s special constitutional status in 2019.

title: TMC student leader says many like rape accused Monojit Mishra present in other Kolkata colleges
content: Party leaders ask why Rajanya Halder, a suspended Trinamool Congress student leader, had not brought the accusations to the party’s notice before

title: Madhya Pradesh High Court notice to State govt. over recently notified promotion rules
content: The provisions under the new rules include 20% reservation for the ST and 16% for the SC communities, while the employees from the two communities will also be eligible for promotions based on merit.

title: Japanese Coast Guard ship arrives at Chennai for joint exercises
content: Over the course of a week-long visit, the JCGS Itsukushima will participate in official courtesy calls, reciprocal ship visits, and joint training and interactive sessions

title: Six people from West Bengal deported by Delhi Police
content: Both families have written to the Delhi Police seeking a response, and said that they shall approach the courts

title: Bengal school recruitment scam: Exclude tainted candidates from fresh recruitment process in West Bengal, says HC
content: Tainted refers to candidates who used corruption and fraud to get the jobs while untainted refers to teachers against whom there are no such allegations

title: Five members of family burnt alive in Bihar’s Purnia district on allegation of witchcraft
content: Incident took place on Sunday, July 6, night at Tetgama village under Muffasil Police station, three arrested

title: Bear that killed 3 men battered to death by angry locals in M.P.
content: Five villagers tried to chase away the bear to rescue the buffalo, which caused the animal to attack them

title: Nadda should be held accountable for NMC, PCI bribery scandal: Congress
content: “How could such widespread manipulation of inspections, approvals, and biometric systems happen without tacit approval from above?” asks the party

title: ‘Safety Club’ launched in educational institutes to foster student empowerment
content: Planned activities include cyber safety campaigns, anti-drug drives, mental health awareness weeks, legal awareness and rights sessions, and digital detox programmes for students and parents

title: T.N. State Planning Commission’s report shows increase in built-up area over 30 years has fuelled heat stress
content: Parts of Chennai, Karur, and Ramanathapuram are now among Tamil Nadu’s most heat-vulnerable hotspots, while even cooler regions such as Udhagamandalam and Kodaikanal have become hotter, the report says

title: Akasa Air picks Hyderabad’s GMR Aero Technic for base maintenance of its Boeing 737 MAX fleet
content: Under the agreement, GMR Aero Technic will carry out scheduled base maintenance checks at its MRO facility located within the Hyderabad airport

title: T.N. Planning Commission submits four reports to Chief Minister M.K. Stalin
content: The reports listed recommendations for land-use planning, child nutrition, thermal stress management, and nature-based solutions in Tier 2 cities

title: Siddaramaiah and D.K. Shivakumar visiting Delhi; appointments to boards and corporations likely to be discussed
content: CM to meet Rajnath Singh to seek air show during Dasara in Mysuru & DCM meeting Jal Shakthi Minister over Yettinhole issue

title: Army Chief commends Major who helped woman deliver baby at Jhansi railway station
content: The ADGPI said Major Bachwala Rohit noticed a pregnant woman in distress at the station and conducted an emergency delivery, using improvised resources, including a towel, a knife and hair clips. He also effectively handled the complications the mother developed after the delivery

title: Rampant traffic rule violations put commuters at risk
content: Motor Vehicles department takes action against 40 bus operators; over 4,000 violations, including overspeeding, reported last month

title: Maharashtra linguistic groups, actors, politicians protest over Narendra Jadhav panel
content: “At least 25 organisations backed the protest, demanding resignation of the School Education Minister Dada Bhuse,” Sushil Shejule, a member of the Marathi Shala Sanstha, said

title: JioBlackRock Mutual Fund raises over ₹17,800 crore via maiden NFO
content: The fund was mobilised from three cash/debt mutual fund schemes — JioBlackRock Overnight Fund, JioBlackRock Liquid Fund and JioBlackRock Money Market Fund

title: Schools under govt.’s free residential schooling for SC students charging fees under various pretexts
content: Social Justice Ministry warns schools, says “strict action” will be taken through CBSE for violating guidelines

title: UP Man Slits Girlfriend's Throat Over Suspicion Of Affairs: Cops
content: A man allegedly killed a woman he was in a relationship with by slitting her throat with a knife in Haridwar on Monday, police said.

title: "Witch Hunt": Trump, Brazil's Lula Clash Over Bolsonaro Coup Trial
content: US-Brazil relations slid into crisis Monday after President Donald Trump criticized the high-profile coup trial of his right-wing ally, ex-president Jair Bolsonaro.

title: "Options Trading Playground For Big Players": Rahul Gandhi On Jane Street Saga
content: Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that the futures and options (F&O) trading market has become a playground for 'big players,' and the Jane Street saga shows that retail investors are bearing the maximum brunt.

title: Minister Bandi Sanjay Attacks Congress, Alleges Special Treatment To Akbaruddin Owaisi
content: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Bandi Sanjay Kumar launched a scathing attack on the Telangana government on Monday, questioning alleged special exemptions granted to AIMIM leader Akbaruddin Owaisi's family.

title: 4 Africans Arrested For 'Drug Peddling' In Hyderabad, Deported
content: Four African nationals were arrested on charges of overstaying their visa and peddling drugs, and have been deported.

title: Cab Driver By Day, Gang Member By Night: Delhi Cops Arrest Neeraj Bawana's Associate
content: A 34-year-old man, who was a cab driver by day in Mumbai and a member of Neeraj Bawana gang by night, was arrested after evading arrest for nearly three years, police said on Monday.

title: Doctor Suspended For Refusing Anti-Rabies Shot To Wife Of Padma Shri Awardee In Madhya Pradesh
content: A doctor at a community health centre in Dhar district has been suspended for allegedly refusing to administer an anti-rabies injection to the wife of Subroto Das, a Padma Shri awardee, over the weekend, an official said on Monday.

title: Probe Agency Conducts Searches In Premises Of 3 Suspected UP Shell Companies
content: Directorate of Enforcement (ED), Chandigarh Zonal Office has carried out search operations at the premises of three suspected shell companies located in Uttar Pradesh's Noida and Lucknow, the central agency said on Monday.

title: Delhi BJP Alleges Rs 200 Crore Widow Pension Scam Under AAP Government
content: The Delhi BJP on Monday alleged large-scale corruption in the widow pension scheme during the tenure of the previous Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government.

title: BJP By His Side, EPS Begins Tamil Nadu Poll Campaign, Vows to End DMK Rule
content: Making a strong political pitch ahead of the high-stakes Assembly elections in Tamil Nadu next year, AIADMK Chief Edappadi K Palaniswami kickstarted his statewide "election yatra" from the party's western stronghold of Mettupalayam in Coimbatore.

title: Delhi Speaker Junks Rs 94-Lakh Bathroom Makeover Claim, Congress Hits Back
content: A fresh political face-off has erupted between the Delhi Assembly Speaker and the Congress over the alleged Rs 2.35 crore renovation of the Speaker's official residence, including a reported Rs 94.69 lakh spent on bathrooms alone.

title: Watch: Thief Abandons Bike, Flees After Guards Stop Him In Delhi Society
content: A routine security check at Delhi's Press Enclave Society turned into a dramatic chase on Monday afternoon, when guards identified and attempted to catch a repeat offender who had previously stolen inverters from the residential colony.

title: 2 Arrested In Connection With Gopal Khemka Murder Case: Police
content: Two persons have been arrested in connection with the murder of Patna-based industrialist Gopal Khemka, including the man who had pulled the trigger, a senior police officer said on Monday.

title: Iran President Says Israel Attempted To Assassinate Him
content: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian said in an interview that Israel, which last month fought a 12-day war with Iran, had attempted to assassinate him.

title: Record-Breaking Temperatures In June Around The World
content: From Nigeria to Japan, Pakistan to Spain, the month of June was the hottest ever recorded in 12 countries and was exceptionally warm in 26 other countries.

title: 'Take Steps To Stop Sand Mining Along Yamuna': Delhi Chief Minister To Yogi Adityanath
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta has written to her Uttar Pradesh counterpart Yogi Adityanath, urging immediate action to curb illegal sand mining along the Yamuna River near the Delhi-UP border.

title: "Relationship Has Been...": Trump Slaps 25% Tariffs On Japan, South Korea
content: US President Donald Trump said he was slapping 25 percent tariffs on imports from Japan and South Korea, in his first letters to trading partners ahead of a deadline to reach a deal.

title: What PM Modi Gifted To Argentine, Trinidad & Tobago Leaders
content: As part of deepening diplomatic ties, India has presented a series of culturally significant gifts to the top leadership of Argentina, and Trinidad & Tobago.

title: Rs 10,000 Crore Sanctioned In Union Budget For Bihar Rail Network: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Monday said Rs 10,000 crore has been sanctioned in this year's Union Budget for strengthening rail infrastructure in Bihar.

title: Poll Body Fact Checks Mallikarjun Kharge's Post On Voter List Revision
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has fact checked Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's post on the special intensive revision (SIR) exercise, or voter list revision, being carried out in Bihar ahead of the assembly election.

title: Saniya Rivers, Aziaha James set to produce
content: Saniya Rivers' emergence for the Sun and Aziaha James' ascent to a prominent starting role on the Wings highlight the top pickups of the week.

title: India will give a ‘new form’ to BRICS grouping in 2026: PM Modi
content: India gave priority to the issues of the Global South during leadership of G-20, and will similarly take BRICS forward in the spirit of humanity first, says PM as New Delhi prepares to take over leadership of grouping from current president Brazil

title: Bihar DGP says Gopal Khemka’s shooter will be nabbed soon; as more murders follow, Opposition, ally target Nitish government
content: DGP Vinay Kumar says over a dozen people have been detained on suspicion, and the Patna jail raids are part of the investigation as criminals might have a ‘lot of information’. He says the police are investigating why Mr. Khemka’s security was withdrawn in 2024. Three more murdered in the State on Sunday night

title: Election Commission says 36.47% of enlisted voters have submitted enumeration forms for Bihar SIR
content: The names of all voters who have submitted the forms will be included in the draft Electoral Rolls to be published on August 1

title: Union Tourism Minister Shekhawat appreciates uptick in tourist footfall in Kashmir
content: He said the regular visits of Ministers and inter-Ministerial coordination meetings were helping in the revival of tourism

title: In Bihar SIR challenge, Supreme Court refers to 1977 verdict on Election Commission’s powers
content: Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia refers to the court’s observation that ‘a free and fair election based on universal adult franchise is the basic’, and that powers of the EC under Article 324 must not end up creating a ‘constitutional despot’

title: Modi government is fixated on big businesses, says Jairam Ramesh
content: The Congress general secretary (communications) says concentration of resources in industry has raised prices for consumers and is one of the main sources of inflation. The Modi government is fixated on big businesses instead of betting big on small businesses, he says

title: Normalcy is returning in Manipur, says Sunil Ambekar
content: Sharing the Sangh’s plan to mark its centenary, Sunil Ambekar says the organisation is looking to reach out to every village and every house

title: 50,000 maritime sector jobs for northeast youth planned, says Sonowal
content: The Minister of Ports, Shipping, and Waterways said India’s ports are now globally competitive, with nine of them ranking in the world’s top 100

title: Over 30 crore workers, farmers will join strike against govt.’s policies, say trade unions
content: They say workers have supported the 17-point charter of demands of the strike, called against Union Government’s policies

title: House sites will be distributed to all beneficiaries in Gannavaram soon, says A.P. Energy Minister
content: Calls upon the public to make the most of the schemes being implemented by the government, and enquires about the disbursement of pensions and other benefits

title: BBMP proposed to be split up into five corporations
content: The proposed five corporations have been carved out in such a way that the maximum variance in revenue generation among them is ₹100 Crore

title: Sakambari festival commences at Indrakeeladri
content: Presiding deity decorated as ‘Sakambari Devi’ with fruit, vegetables, green leaves and flowers on the first day of the three-day festival

title: Polluting cooking fuel users may be at a higher risk of cognitive impairment finds study in Karnataka
content: The study, published in The Lancet found that users of only polluting cooking fuel, primarily rural women, had significantly lower scores in global cognition, visuospatial ability and executive functions

title: Karnataka commercial vehicle operators demand inclusion in FASTag annual toll scheme
content: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways recently unveiled an annual FASTag pass scheme for non-commercial vehicles at a fixed cost of ₹3,000, aiming to streamline toll payments and promote digital transactions

title: Kapil Dev expresses interest in partnering with Telangana to transform sports ecosystem
content: The legendary cricketer and film actor Ajay Devgan called on Chief Minister Revanth Reddy in New Delhi on Monday

title: A.P.’s Foreign Medical Graduates look for internships in other States, thanks to regulatory tangles
content: More than 250 FMGs have reportedly applied for internships in Telangana and other States as they are unable to get necessary clearances from Andhra Pradesh Medical Council for various reasons related to their online study during the COVID pandemic, which is seriously jeopardising their career

title: Party high command wants Siddaramaiah to continue as CM, says Hebbalkar
content: The Minsiter has said that it is a good thing that the party has considered the extension of Siddaramaiah’s tenure

title: 29.5 kg of gold from Kanaka Durga temple deposited under GMS scheme
content: As per the prevailing market rate of ₹9,010 per gram for 22-carat gold, the total estimated value of the deposited ornaments is approximately ₹26.58 crore

title: Immediately stop Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, say INDIA bloc leaders
content: Rashtriya Janata Dal, Congress, Vikassheel Insaan Party and the Left parties say ECI should not create doubts in the minds of common people and end the complex processes

title: Chittoor police grant conditional permission for Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy’s visit to Bangarupalyam to meet mango farmers on July 9
content: This is not a public meeting. No rally or roadshow is permitted between the helipad and the market yard, says the SP

title: State conference to oppose smart meters and true-up charges on July 13
content: State government is implementing smart meters as part of the Central government’s privatisation drive, allege United Forum of People’s Organisations’ leaders

title: Arunachal Pradesh officials warned against violating Supreme Court judgment on Chakma-Hajong issue
content: The agenda of a meeting between the State’s Home Department officials and the representatives of an apex students’ body will attract contempt of court, a Delhi-based rights group said

title: Class tests mandatory every month: Minister
content: The plan is to assess school students’ academic performance and provide additional academic support to the needy. Discussions on implementing the academic master plan for schools also held.

title: Hindi row: Why Uddhav Sena has distanced itself from Stalin's hardline stance
content: Following a rare show of unity against "Hindi imposition," Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin sought support from Uddhav Thackeray. However, Shiv Sena (UBT) distanced itself from DMK's radical stance, clarifying their opposition is against forced imposition, not the language itself. With BMC elections approaching, BJP aims to consolidate North Indian voters in Mumbai.

title: Trump releases tariff letters: Countries facing up to 40% duties from August 1
content: Donald Trump's administration has released letters to trading partners, announcing reciprocal tariffs effective August 1, 2025. Tariffs of 25% will be imposed on Japan, South Korea, Kazakhstan, and Malaysia, while Myanmar and Laos face 40%, and South Africa 30%.

title: Ukraine war, sanctions cast shadow on Indo-Russian joint venture for 200 choppers
content: The Indo-Russian joint venture to manufacture Kamov helicopters in India is facing significant delays due to the Ukraine war, Western sanctions, and supply chain disruptions. HAL is awaiting certification status from the Russians before making further decisions. Consequently, HAL is shifting its focus towards indigenous helicopter platforms like LUH, LCH, and IMRH, with production centralized at the Tumakuru facility.

title: After US arrest, terrorist Passia may soon be sent to India
content: Pro-Khalistan terrorist Harpreet Singh, alias Happy Passia, a key operative for the ISI, is expected to be extradited from the US to India soon after his arrest in California. Accused of orchestrating grenade attacks and terror activities in Punjab, Passia faces charges related to targeting law enforcement, sacred sites, and prominent figures.

title: Trump holds off on 10% tariff threat against Brics nations, but reiterates ultimatum
content: The Trump administration is holding off on immediately imposing a 10% tariff on Brics nations, despite President Trump's warning of trade penalties for countries embracing "anti-American policies." The tariff will only be activated if specific Brics nations take steps seen as directly hostile to US interests.

title: Bill Gates out of world’s 10 richest man list; net worth falls 30% in 7 days
content: Bill Gates has fallen out of the top ten richest people due to a recalculation reflecting his significant charitable donations. His net worth decreased by $52 billion, moving him to twelfth place, while Steve Ballmer, his former assistant and Microsoft's ex-CEO, now ranks higher with $172 billion.

title: Plane on runway, incoming SWISS flight safely executes last-min go-around at IGIA
content: A potential collision was averted at Delhi's IGIA when an Indian carrier's A320, arriving from Phuket, slowed down and failed to promptly vacate the runway. This forced the Delhi ATC to instruct a SWISS Airbus A330, approaching from Zurich, to execute a go-around at 1,400 feet.

title: Tainted candidates can't apply for school jobs, rules Calcutta HC
content: Calcutta High Court has barred candidates identified as tainted in the 2016 Bengal SSC panel from participating in the fresh recruitment process for 35,726 vacancies, directing SSC to cancel their applications. The court refused to interfere with marks allotment and age relaxation issues to maintain the Supreme Court's timeline for the recruitment.

title: Scam victim to whistleblower: Hyderabad graduate ends influencers’ 'betting' innings
content: Driven by personal loss, a Hyderabad MBA graduate exposed an online cricket betting scam after losing a significant amount of money and his friend to suicide. He meticulously gathered evidence against influencers who lured Telugu youth with false promises of fixed matches. His efforts led to police action, resulting in arrests and preventing further exploitation of vulnerable individuals.

title: Tesla board urged to question Elon Musk by former DOGE adviser
content: Former DOGE advisor James Fishback is critical of Elon Musk's decision to form the America Party, citing concerns about Musk's focus on Tesla. Fishback's firm, Azoria Partners, has postponed the launch of its Tesla ETF due to potential conflicts with Musk's CEO responsibilities. US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent also suggested Musk should prioritize his companies over political endeavors.

title: Food to fashion: Companies see demand recovery signs
content: Consumer spending increased on various goods in the June quarter. This signals a revival in demand after a period of sluggish urban consumption. Dabur experienced growth in the FMCG sector. Marico faced challenges due to high copra prices. Nykaa's beauty segment saw growth. Kalyan Jewellers' sales were boosted by wedding demand. Trent, however, indicated slower revenue growth.

title: Drug regulator issues list of drugs that should be flushed if unused or expired
content: India's drug regulatory body, CDSCO, advises flushing 17 specific drugs, including painkillers and anti-anxiety medications, down the sink if unused or expired due to potential harm. For other medications, they recommend scientific disposal through 'drug take back' initiatives to prevent environmental pollution. Studies reveal that improper disposal leads to drug presence in water sources, contributing to multi-drug resistant pathogens.

title: Trump to sign order delaying tariff deadline to Aug 1: White House
content: President Trump is delaying the tariff deadline for countries without trade agreements with the US to August 1, releasing tariff letters to Japan and South Korea, imposing 25% rates. These tariffs could be lowered with negotiated deals but raised if retaliatory measures are considered.

title: US Air Force halts SpaceX Rocket Project: Reason may be Elon Musk’s comments on…
content: The U.S. Air Force has suspended its plan to collaborate with SpaceX for hypersonic rocket cargo deliveries from Johnston Atoll due to environmental concerns. Biologists and experts feared the project would endanger numerous seabirds nesting on the remote Pacific wildlife refuge.

title: Can't allow weaponisation of critical minerals: PM Modi at Brics
content: PM Narendra Modi urged Brics nations to secure critical mineral and tech supply chains. He wants to prevent any single country from weaponizing these resources. This call happened amidst concerns about China's dominance. Modi also suggested strengthening the Brics New Development Bank. He emphasized responsible AI development and global standards for digital content authenticity.

title: aylor Swift stays private — opts out of Fourth with Travis Kelce — avoids party spotlight
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce kept their Fourth of July celebrations private, a departure from Swift's past lavish parties. Sources reveal Swift is prioritizing a low profile after a challenging year, including controversies surrounding a legal drama and Super Bowl appearance. She's focusing on music, family, and spending time with Kelce, opting for a more intimate celebration.

title: Bill Belichick & Jordon Hudson’s family plans heat up as she welcomes a baby
content: Bill Belichick and Jordon Hudson's relationship continues to spark debate due to their age gap. Recently, Hudson's sister welcomed a baby, prompting Hudson to express her joy as a "proud aunt." This event has fueled speculation about Hudson, 24, potentially starting a family with Belichick, 73. Sources suggest Hudson desires children, while Belichick's friends are reportedly surprised by the possibility.

title: Kevin Love reacts to three-team trade involving Miami Heat, Utah Jazz & LA Clippers
content: Kevin Love expressed shock at being traded to the Utah Jazz in a three-team deal involving the LA Clippers and Miami Heat. The veteran forward acknowledged the NBA's business side. John Collins moved to the Clippers, and Norman Powell went to Miami. Love, previously with the Cavaliers, might face a buyout as the Jazz focus on their future.

title: NHL Trade Rumors: Erik Karlsson linked to Detroit Red Wings
content: Trade talks intensify between the Detroit Red Wings and Pittsburgh Penguins, centering on defenseman Erik Karlsson. Detroit eyes Karlsson to bolster their defense and mentor young talents, potentially shifting their rebuild strategy. Pittsburgh, burdened by Karlsson's hefty contract, seeks cap relief and a possible roster reset after missing the playoffs, signaling diverging franchise directions.

title: Dayton Bramhall cut again — legacy Disney daughter’s emotional Netflix journey
content: Dayton Bramhall, daughter of Shelly, faced challenges in her DCC journey. She auditioned thrice but was cut each time. Despite her family's DCC legacy, she needed to earn her place. The rejection strained relationships, especially with her mother. Dayton now teaches at The Young Company in Texas. She empowers young dancers with her experiences.

title: The Xi question: Is China's 'leader for life' planning his exit?
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping is reportedly delegating authority to key Communist Party institutions, sparking speculation about a potential power transition or retirement plans. This shift comes amid economic pressures, including trade tensions with the US and a housing market slump.

title: 'Bail rule, jail exception' principle forgotten in recent past, says CJI Gavai
content: Chief Justice of India B R Gavai expressed concern over the forgotten principle of 'bail is the rule, jail is the exception,' despite judicial integration. He highlighted his efforts in 2024 to reestablish this principle while granting bail in cases like Prabir Purkayastha, Manish Sisodia and Kavita vs ED.

title: Tesla free-fall: Musk fights Trump, loses Xi - 'America Party' adds to chaos
content: Tesla shares plummeted following escalating tensions between Elon Musk and Donald Trump, compounded by declining vehicle deliveries. Musk's launch of the "America Party" further unsettled investors, already concerned about Trump's potential impact on Tesla's subsidies and Musk's divided attention. Tesla faces challenges in China, losing market share to domestic competitors like BYD and Xiaomi.

title: England beat India, but how many did 14-yo Suryavanshi score?
content: India's U-19 team concluded their England tour with a disappointing seven-wicket loss in the final Youth ODI, despite having already secured the series. Young Vaibhav Suryavanshi, however, continued to impress with a fighting 33, following his earlier record-breaking century. England comfortably chased down India's total of 210, led by Ben Mayes' unbeaten 82, ending the series on a high note.

title: Tourism showing signs of revival in Kashmir, govt initiatives helping: Union min
content: Union Tourism Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat announced that tourism in Kashmir is recovering after the Pahalgam terror attack, thanks to initiatives by the central and J&K governments. He emphasized the Valley's safety and the aim to develop 50 iconic global standard destinations across India. Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha reviewed Amarnath Yatra arrangements at Nunwan Base camp, ensuring a safe pilgrimage.

title: 'Where am I safe?': Woman narrates face-off with MNS leader's son
content: Social media influencer Rajshree More accused Rahil Shaikh, son of an MNS leader, of abuse and threats following a road accident in Mumbai. Shaikh, allegedly drunk, hurled slurs and invoked his MNS affiliation. More claimed she was targeted for supporting inclusivity and faced threats from MNS workers demanding an apology. Police have booked Shaikh for multiple offenses, including drunk driving.

title: Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2 promo: Smriti Irani is back as Tulsi
content: Smriti Irani is making a comeback to television with the revival of her iconic show Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi, reprising her role as Tulsi Virani. The show, a cultural phenomenon that resonated deeply with Indian families, is set to rekindle nostalgia and unite audiences once again.

title: Virat, Anushka spotted together at Wimbledon; pic goes viral - more photos inside
content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma graced Wimbledon 2025 on Day 8, adding star power to the Royal Box. Their appearance, alongside Roger and Mirka Federer, drew attention amidst thrilling matches featuring Djokovic, Navarro, and Sinner. Wimbledon 2025 has attracted numerous high-profile figures, solidifying its status as a magnet for celebrities and global icons.

title: Red-faced Pak army chief makes desperate claim after India exposes axis
content: Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, refuted claims of external assistance during the recent conflict with India, dismissing them as false and an attempt to undermine Pakistan's capabilities. He criticized India for involving other nations in a bilateral issue and warned of a strong response to any future aggression.

title: Akash Deep: A Mohammed Rafi fan who once called cricket ‘ameeron ka khel,’ is now India’s hero
content: Akash Deep lost his father and elder brother in six months when he was 18. During the second wave of the coronavirus pandemic, after struggling to procure an oxygen cylinder for his mother, she survived. Earlier this year, while undergoing rehab at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru, he was busy Googling the best doctor for liver cancer in India to treat his elder sister. Fast forward to the last week at Edgbaston, he produced two great spells to dismantle England’s top order and led India to a win, and to add to that, earned himself a song from the Brummies.

title: NYC elections: Meet the millionaires supporting socialist Zohran Mamdani
content: Zohran Mamdani, a democratic socialist, secured a decisive victory in the Democratic mayoral primary, surprisingly garnering support from young professionals in tech and finance. While some Wall Street figures express alarm, others see an opportunity to reshape the city's power dynamics.

title: Musk posts 'arrest counter' of Epstein case; fresh dig at Trump?
content: Elon Musk posted an "arrest counter" on X, highlighting zero arrests in the Jeffrey Epstein case, seemingly targeting Donald Trump. This follows reports that the DOJ and FBI found no evidence Epstein was murdered or blackmailed powerful figures. Musk previously alleged Trump's name appears in sealed documents related to the case.

title: Gifts from Modi carry Ayodhya’s spiritual legacy and folk artistry abroad
content: During Prime Minister Modi's visit from July 2-5, India gifted culturally significant items to leaders in Argentina and Trinidad & Tobago, aiming to strengthen bilateral ties. Argentina received a hand-etched silver lion and a Madhubani painting, while Trinidad & Tobago was presented with a Kalash containing sacred Sarayu water and a silver replica of the Ayodhya Ram Temple.

title: 'Mahi bhai, keep playing': Indian cricketer wishes Dhoni on his 44th birthday
content: MS Dhoni celebrated his 44th birthday amid fervent wishes, with fans hoping to see him continue in the IPL. Despite age and a knee issue, he led CSK admirably in IPL 2025 after Ruturaj Gaikwad's injury. Recently inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame, Dhoni's future in IPL 2026 remains uncertain, hinging on his hunger, fitness, and team requirements.

title: 'Even if India lose the series ...' - Yograj after India beat England at Edgbaston
content: Former Indian cricketer Yograj Singh urged to support Gautam Gambhir. This comes after India's victory at Edgbaston, where Shubman Gill led the team to victory over the hosts and leveled the series 1-1. Yograj urged critics to back Gambhir, highlights Gambhir's positive contribution to Indian cricket. India take on England at Lord's on Thursday.

title: AB de Villiers makes massive MS Dhoni revelation on birthday: 'It was very difficult to ...'
content: AB de Villiers honoured MS Dhoni on his 44th birthday, acknowledging his intimidating presence and remarkable career. Dhoni's captaincy led India to victory in three major ICC tournaments. Former selector Kiran More recognised Dhoni's aggressive batting style. Dhoni's recent induction into the ICC Hall of Fame celebrates his significant contributions to cricket.

title: IND vs ENG: Vaughan lambasts England player after loss - 'He has to count himself fortunate'
content: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has strongly criticised Zak Crawley's inconsistent Test performance, questioning his place despite a recent 65 against India. Geoffrey Boycott echoed these concerns, citing Crawley's ingrained flaws and insufficient run-scoring. India's victory at Edgbaston, fueled by Akash Deep's bowling, intensified scrutiny on England's team selection, including Chris Woakes' declining performance, prompting calls for strategic changes.

title: Climate justice a moral duty, not an option: PM Modi at Brics Summit
content: During India's Brics presidency, Prime Minister Modi envisions redefining the bloc with a focus on resilience, innovation, cooperation, and sustainability. He emphasized climate justice as a moral duty and advocated for global collaboration on health solutions, highlighting the interconnectedness of planetary and human well-being.

title: 'Patak patak ke marenge': BJP MP Dubey targets Thackerays amid language row
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey's inflammatory remarks against those opposing Hindi imposition in Maharashtra have ignited a political firestorm. Dubey's threat to "thrash" Hindi speakers' detractors drew sharp criticism from Shiv Sena (UBT) and other opposition parties, who accused the BJP of attempting to divide the state for electoral gains.

title: Bihar horror: 5 of family killed in Purnea over witchcraft, black magic suspicions
content: In Bihar's Purnea district, a horrific incident unfolded where five family members were allegedly murdered and their bodies burned due to suspicions of witchcraft. Police have arrested three individuals in connection with the crime, which occurred in Tetma village. The killings may have been triggered by the recent death of a child, leading to accusations of black magic.

title: Russell Wilson’s Marvel debut: Wife Ciara celebrates with sweet shoutout;
content: Ciara supports Russell Wilson as his clothing label, 3BRAND, appears in Marvel's Ironheart. The brand made its TV debut in the Disney+ series. Wilson shared his excitement on social media. Ciara also expressed her pride. 3BRAND's appearance raises its profile in fashion and entertainment. The couple's business bond continues to grow. Their influence has now reached a global superhero stage.

title: 'Boosted momentum': Pirate Software as Stop Killing Games hits 1 million signatures
content: The Stop Killing Games petition surpassed a million signatures, fueled by an unexpected twist. Pirate Software's criticism sparked a social media backlash, ironically boosting the movement as supporters rallied against his perceived villain narrative. Despite his claims of minimal impact, the controversy surrounding his stance unified SKG advocates, injecting fresh energy into the campaign.

title: NHL free agency tracker: Updated list of the summer signings
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

title: Nine players who will score more TDs in 2025
content: 169 instances in which a wide receiver or tight end scored fewer than five touchdowns on 50-plus offensive touches before managing at least 50 touches the very next season . of those 169, 114 (67.5%) scored more touchdowns the next season, focusing in on the 48 players in that group who scored less than three touchdowns during the first year .

title: ACC preview: Clemson is the team to beat, but contenders are lining up
content: the ACC crown has gone to either Dabo Swinney's Clemson Tigers or to someone who managed to beat them in the regular season . over the past 10 of those 14 years, the ac has won eight titles . last year they became the first bid thief of the expanded College Football Playoff era .

title: Who dropped out of the top 10? Players eyeing a bounce-back at 11 positions
content: sportsmail's survey of the top 10 players at every position is unveiled . ranked candidates based on top-10 votes, composite average and interviews . more than 70 voters submitted a ballot on at least one position, and in many cases all positions .

title: Research scholars conduct field study in Bekal

title: How the VAR cost USMNT a crucial handball penalty in Gold Cup final
content: Mauricio Pochettino says a penalty should have been given for handball . the united states lost 2-1 to Mexico in the concacaf gold cup final on sunday . lvarez's goal was initially ruled out for offside, but the referee and the VAR ignored claims .

title: Topuria? Ruffy? Wellmaker? Who owns the best KO of the year's first half?
content: the year is halfway over, and more than half of the world's 11 championships have changed hands . it's been a fertile time for the emergence of new champions and the disappearance of old champs in odd ways . Islam Makhachev announced in may he was vacating the lightweight championship .
